channel.title: Ebay being wierd?
channel.description:
K I bought something for the first time on ebay last week (a £10 watch from hong kong), used paypal etc. When I paid for the item, paypal said my bank had declined the direct debit request and removed the bank from my paypal. I've paid for stuff using paypal many times before. I googled this and lots of people seem to have the problem now and again.. so whatever.
Anyway the guy sent a request on ebay on the same day the payment failed asking me if I would like to cancel the transaction because "Buyer did not want item". So I agreed to cancel it because he'd probably run out of watches and it'd take me a week to get my bank account working with paypal again. But the watch arrived today?? Has this ever happened to you, what's going on?
tldr; Bought something off ebay > Payment failed > Still got item

item.title: Ebay being wierd?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“chri5, post:10, topic:343434”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=439830.msg3232103#msg3232103 date=1276160946]
I wanna know wats happening tho. My dad thinks its a scam so they can sue me, and my mum says they’ve put bird flu in the package.

Maybe the guy just got confused and I’ll hear no more about it?
[/quote]
Your parents are retards.

How about this: Keep the watch, if they ask for it back send it back. You won’t get sued for £10.

And your bank transfer probably got rejected (Underage, not having enough available balance and as you’re underage you cannot get an overdraft)

Next time get a debit card.[/quote]I’m sorry, what? If I was underage I wouldn’t have the bank account in the first place. And it is a debit card, I thought a bank account and debit card were basically the same thing. I checked the balance from a cash machine yesterday too, and it had just under £100 in it.

And thanks for stating the obvious about my parents. Sometimes they say more retarded shit than I do.

Read full topic

item.title: Ebay being wierd?
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:3, topic:343434”]I wanna know wats happening tho. My dad thinks its a scam so they can sue me, and my mum says they’ve put bird flu in the package.

Maybe the guy just got confused and I’ll hear no more about it?[/quote]
Your parents are retards.

How about this: Keep the watch, if they ask for it back send it back. You won’t get sued for £10.

And your bank transfer probably got rejected (Underage, not having enough available balance and as you’re underage you cannot get an overdraft)

Next time get a debit card.

Read full topic

item.title: Ebay being wierd?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:7, topic:343434”]flu cant survive more than like a week[/quote]shipped on monday, arrived today.

BloodRayne:

My mom has bought china(dishes, not place) from reputable dealers on eBay before and ended up receiving items free because of errors with PayPal. The dealers never complained though, is it possible that PayPal covers their errors?

it’s possible, but paypal are usually cunts so i doubt they would have done that. paypal might have sent the error messages wrongly, and my bank may still have been charged. i’ll have to wait til i get my next statement…

Read full topic

and my mum says they’ve put bird flu in the package.

I grinned.
[/quote]lol… how do u put bird flu in the package wtf that’s like sending anthrax by mail…[/quote]

I guess if you had bird flu you could cough into it? Hehe.
